trans-unit.source: Azure SQL Database Transact-SQL Information | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Database Transact-SQL Information | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Transact-SQL statements in Azure SQL Database
trans-unit.target: Transact-SQL statements in Azure SQL Database

trans-unit.source: Most SQL Server 2016 Transact-SQL statements are fully supported in Microsoft Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Most SQL Server 2016 Transact-SQL statements are fully supported in Microsoft Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: This includes the SQL Server data types, operators, and the string, arithmetic, logical, cursor functions, and the other Transact-SQL elements that most applications depend upon.
trans-unit.target: This includes the SQL Server data types, operators, and the string, arithmetic, logical, cursor functions, and the other Transact-SQL elements that most applications depend upon.

trans-unit.source: Partially or unsupported functions are usually related to differences in how SQL Database manages the database (such as file, high availability, and security features) or for special purpose features such as service broker.
trans-unit.target: Partially or unsupported functions are usually related to differences in how SQL Database manages the database (such as file, high availability, and security features) or for special purpose features such as service broker.

trans-unit.source: Because SQL Database isolates many features from dependency on the master database, many server-level activities are inappropriate and unsupported.
trans-unit.target: Because SQL Database isolates many features from dependency on the master database, many server-level activities are inappropriate and unsupported.

trans-unit.source: Features deprecated in SQL Server are generally not supported in SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Features deprecated in SQL Server are generally not supported in SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: This topic discusses the features that are available with SQL Database when upgraded to the free SQL Database V12.
trans-unit.target: This topic discusses the features that are available with SQL Database when upgraded to the free SQL Database V12.

trans-unit.source: For more information about V12, see [SQL Database V12 What's New](sql-database-v12-whats-new.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about V12, see [SQL Database V12 What's New](sql-database-v12-whats-new.md).

trans-unit.source: SQL Database V12 adds performance and manageability improvements, as well as support for additional features.
trans-unit.target: SQL Database V12 adds performance and manageability improvements, as well as support for additional features.

trans-unit.source: The added features are listed below, separated into the features that are fully supported, and the features that are partially supported.
trans-unit.target: The added features are listed below, separated into the features that are fully supported, and the features that are partially supported.

trans-unit.source: Features that are partially supported in SQL Database V12
trans-unit.target: Features that are partially supported in SQL Database V12

trans-unit.source: SQL Database V12 supports some but not all of the arguments that exist in the corresponding SQL Server 2016 Transact-SQL statements.
trans-unit.target: SQL Database V12 supports some but not all of the arguments that exist in the corresponding SQL Server 2016 Transact-SQL statements.

trans-unit.source: For example, the CREATE PROCEDURE statement is available however the WITH ENCRYPTION option of CREATE PROCEDURE is not available.
trans-unit.target: For example, the CREATE PROCEDURE statement is available however the WITH ENCRYPTION option of CREATE PROCEDURE is not available.

trans-unit.source: Refer to the linked syntax topics for details about the supported areas of each statement.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the linked syntax topics for details about the supported areas of each statement.

trans-unit.source: DMV's are generally available for features that are available
trans-unit.target: DMV's are generally available for features that are available

trans-unit.source: Features that are not supported in SQL Database
trans-unit.target: Features that are not supported in SQL Database

trans-unit.source: Windows authentication is not available for logins or contained database users.
trans-unit.target: Windows authentication is not available for logins or contained database users.

trans-unit.source: Cross database queries, cross database ownership chaining, TRUSTWORTHY setting
trans-unit.target: Cross database queries, cross database ownership chaining, TRUSTWORTHY setting

trans-unit.source: Eventing: events, event notifications, query notifications
trans-unit.target: Eventing: events, event notifications, query notifications

trans-unit.source: Features related to database file placement, size, and database files which are automatically managed by Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: Features related to database file placement, size, and database files which are automatically managed by Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: Features that relate to high availability which is managed through your Microsoft Azure account: backup, restore, AlwaysOn, database mirroring, log shipping, recovery modes.
trans-unit.target: Features that relate to high availability which is managed through your Microsoft Azure account: backup, restore, AlwaysOn, database mirroring, log shipping, recovery modes.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see Azure SQL Database Backup and Restore.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see Azure SQL Database Backup and Restore.

trans-unit.source: Features that rely upon the log reader: Replication, Change Data Capture.
trans-unit.target: Features that rely upon the log reader: Replication, Change Data Capture.

trans-unit.source: Features that rely upon the SQL Server Agent or the MSDB database: jobs, alerts, operators, Policy-Based Management, database mail, central management servers.
trans-unit.target: Features that rely upon the SQL Server Agent or the MSDB database: jobs, alerts, operators, Policy-Based Management, database mail, central management servers.

trans-unit.source: Hardware related server settings: memory, worker threads, CPU affinity, trace flags, etc. Use service levels instead.
trans-unit.target: Hardware related server settings: memory, worker threads, CPU affinity, trace flags, etc. Use service levels instead.

trans-unit.source: Linked servers, OPENQUERY, OPENROWSET, OPENDATASOURCE, BULK INSERT, 3 and 4 part names
trans-unit.target: Linked servers, OPENQUERY, OPENROWSET, OPENDATASOURCE, BULK INSERT, 3 and 4 part names

trans-unit.source: Sever-level items: Server roles, IS_SRVROLEMEMBER, sys.login_token.
trans-unit.target: Sever-level items: Server roles, IS_SRVROLEMEMBER, sys.login_token.

trans-unit.source: Server level permissions are not available though some are replaced by database-level permissions.
trans-unit.target: Server level permissions are not available though some are replaced by database-level permissions.

trans-unit.source: Some server-level DMV's are not available though some are replaced by database-level DMV's.
trans-unit.target: Some server-level DMV's are not available though some are replaced by database-level DMV's.

trans-unit.source: SQL Server audit (use SQL Database auditing instead)
trans-unit.target: SQL Server audit (use SQL Database auditing instead)

trans-unit.source: For more information about Transact-SQL grammar, usage, and examples, see [Transact-SQL Reference (Database Engine)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/bb510741.aspx) in SQL Server Books Online.
trans-unit.target: For more information about Transact-SQL grammar, usage, and examples, see [Transact-SQL Reference (Database Engine)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/bb510741.aspx) in SQL Server Books Online.

trans-unit.source: The Transact-SQL reference includes topics related to SQL Server 2008, SQL Server 2008 R2, SQL Server 2012, SQL Server 2014, and Microsoft Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: The Transact-SQL reference includes topics related to SQL Server 2008, SQL Server 2008 R2, SQL Server 2012, SQL Server 2014, and Microsoft Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Near the top of each topic is a section indicating which products support the subject of the topic.
trans-unit.target: Near the top of each topic is a section indicating which products support the subject of the topic.

trans-unit.source: If a product is omitted, then the feature described by the topic is not available in that product.
trans-unit.target: If a product is omitted, then the feature described by the topic is not available in that product.

trans-unit.source: For example, availability groups were introduced in SQL Server 2012.
trans-unit.target: For example, availability groups were introduced in SQL Server 2012.

trans-unit.source: The **CREATE AVAILABILTY GROUP** topic indicates it applies to **SQL Server (SQL Server 2012 through current version)** because it does not apply to SQL Server 2008, SQL Server 2008 R2, or Microsoft Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: The **CREATE AVAILABILTY GROUP** topic indicates it applies to **SQL Server (SQL Server 2012 through current version)** because it does not apply to SQL Server 2008, SQL Server 2008 R2, or Microsoft Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: In some cases, the general subject of topic can be used in a product, but all of the arguments are not supported.
trans-unit.target: In some cases, the general subject of topic can be used in a product, but all of the arguments are not supported.

trans-unit.source: For example, contained database users were introduced in SQL Server 2012.
trans-unit.target: For example, contained database users were introduced in SQL Server 2012.

trans-unit.source: The **CREATE USER** statement can be used in any SQL Server product, however the **WITH PASSWORD** syntax cannot be used with older versions.
trans-unit.target: The **CREATE USER** statement can be used in any SQL Server product, however the **WITH PASSWORD** syntax cannot be used with older versions.

trans-unit.source: In this case, additional **Applies to** sections are inserted into the appropriate argument descriptions in the body of the topic.
trans-unit.target: In this case, additional **Applies to** sections are inserted into the appropriate argument descriptions in the body of the topic.
